name: Just to Name a Few... Trivia Quiz | Mixed 10 Questions | 10 Questions

questions.text: Just to name a few...  Barclays, Westpac, Wells Fargo, and HSBC are examples of what?
questions.explanation:
Banks.

	Barclays is an English bank that sponsors the English Premier League, Britain's top pro soccer league. Westpac is a worldwide bank, but mostly situated in Australia and Oceania. They own Wellington, New Zealand's "Westpac Stadium", home of the Wellington Phoenix and Hurricanes. Wells Fargo is an American bank, and one of the country's oldest, opening in 1852.

questions.text: Just to name a few...  "Slowly", "Hopelessly", and "Disgustingly" are what?
options: Words used by Adolf Hitler to describe the British
questions.explanation:
Adverbs.

	Most adverbs can be distinguished by the "-ly" on the end of the word. They are used to describe verbs, adjectives, and other adverbs.

questions.text: Just to name a few... Buenos Aires, Sao Paulo, and Mexico City are all what?
options: Stops made by Bon Jovi on their "Crush" tour
Hosts of the Olympic Games in the 1900s
questions.explanation:
Latin American cities.

	Latin America is geographically considered Mexico south to South America. In terms of population, these three stand as the largest three cities (2010 estimates). Neither Buenos Aires nor Sao Paulo hosted the Olympics in the 1900s. Brasilia is the capital of Brazil.  Lastly, the "Crush" tour never visited Latin America.

questions.text: Just to name a few...  Hamilton, Carroll, and Jerry share what name?
questions.explanation:
Lewis.

	Lewis Hamilton is a British F1 driver who won the World Championship in his second year in the series. Lewis Carroll is a British author, known for writing "Alice's Adventures in Wonderland" and the sequel "Through the Looking Glass". Jerry Lewis is an American actor and comedian, known for his Labour Day telethon in support of Muscular Dystrophy Association.

questions.text: Just to name a few... Billy Ray Cyrus, Judy Garland, and Frank Sinatra all share what in common?
questions.explanation:
Parents of famous kids.

	Miley Cyrus, Liza Minnelli, and Nancy Sinatra are the three "kids" involved. None of the three are from St. Louis. Judy Garland (Frances Ethel Gumm) is the only stage name. Other famous parents with famous kids include Donald Sutherland (son Kiefer), Elvis Presley (daughter Lisa Marie), and Lloyd Bridges (sons Jeff and Beau).

questions.text: Just to name a few... ABC, NBC, and CBS are all examples of what?
questions.explanation:
American TV networks.

	The American Broadcasting Company, National Broadcasting Company, and Columbia Broadcasting System are the three examples of TV networks mentioned. Some others are FOX and PBS (Public Broadcasting System).

questions.text: Just to name a few... Brittany, Picardy, and Lorraine are all examples of what?
options: Three of the most common horse names
questions.explanation:
Regions of France.

	Picardy is a famous region in Northern France, home to many battle scenes from both World Wars.  Lorraine, in the northeastern part of France, is a well-known spot for German-French wars in the 17th and 18th centuries. Brittany is the farthest western region of France, and is known for its Breton music. There are 26 regions in all of France.

questions.text: Just to name a few... "Titanic", "Flushed Away", and "Finding Neverland" are examples of what?
questions.explanation:
Kate Winslet movies.

	Kate Winslet was born in Reading, Berkshire in the UK, and has appeared in many hit Hollywood movies. Other appearances by her include "Little Children", "The Reader", and "Revolutionary Roads". She was born in 1975.

questions.text: Just to name a few...  Luigi, Yoshi, and Toad are examples of what?
options: Winning dogs at the Westminster Dog Show
questions.explanation:
"Super Mario" characters.

	These are three of the five main protagonists, Mario and Princess Peach being the other two.  The "Super Mario" series was created by Nintendo, and has had spin-offs in the forms of books, comic strips, and animated series.  Mario is the mascot of Nintendo.

questions.text: Just to name a few... Yankee Stadium, Wrigley Field and Fenway Park are what?
questions.explanation:
Baseball parks.

	The New York Yankees play at Yankee Stadium.  The Chicago Cubs call Wrigley Field home. The Boston Red Sox claim Fenway Park.
